Query: Read the contents of a zipped file without extraction?

Answers.MP Summary: list, test and extract compressed files in a ZIP archive
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: List the contents of a zip file without extracting
Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_329752: Parallel read the contents of a zipped file without extraction
so_45863093: read the files one by one in a zip file using bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_45863093: unzip -l sample.zip |sed '
  /^ *[0-9][0-9]* *2[0-9-]*  *[0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9]  */!d; s///
' |while IFS= read file
  unzip -p sample.zip "$file" |gunzip -c |while IFS= read line
    # do stuff to "$line" here
  done
done

unzip -p

unzip -l archive.zip

unzip -p sample.zip |gunzip -c |while read line
  # do stuff to "$line"
done

unzip -p archive

Explanations about Options.-p:
extract files to pipe (stdout). Nothing but the file data is sent to stdout , and
 the files are always extracted in binary format, just as they are stored (no
 conversions).

Top-3 Scripts:
so_24065013: touch log1.txt
touch log2.txt

echo 'June 5, 2014. The system works!' >> log1.txt
echo 'June 5, 2014. The system found a problem at line 3!' >> log2.txt

find . -maxdepth 1 -name "log*.txt" | xargs tar -czvf logfiles.tar
gzip logfiles.tar

tar -xvf logfiles.tar.gz log1.txt

tar xfO logfiles.tar.gz log1.txt
tar xfO logfiles.tar.gz log2.txt

tar xfO logfiles.tar.gz log1.txt | less
tar xfO logfiles.tar.gz log2.txt | less

tar xfO logfiles.tar.gz log1.txt | more
tar xfO logfiles.tar.gz log2.txt | more
